my:Details.my:Title: Handling / Stowing Anchor Chain When Weighing Anchor

my:Hazard.my:Description: Working in an enclosed space environment / lack of oxygen
my:Hazard.my:ControlMeasures: a) Enclosed Space procedures must be implemented and followed accordingly. b) A Safe Work Permit must be completed, valid and understood by all involved. c) Enclosed Space Risk Assessment must be consulted, understood and attached to the Safe Work Permit.

a) NOBODY to enter the chain locker during the operation. b) Only experienced crew to carry out this operation. c) Crew must handle chain using the appropriate tool (chain handler) from outside of the locker. d) Use appropriate PPE - helmet, safety shoes, boiler suit, hard hat, gloves. e) The locker must be well illuminated. f) Ensure communications are maintained throughout so that the windlass operator can STOP operations immediately when advised to do so. g) Full situational awareness must be maintained throughout by all crew involved. h) If clutch becomes defective and chain veers overboard LET GO of the chain handling tool immediately and vacate the forecastle compartment.

a) As per above Hazard '2' NO Crew will be working inside the chain locker. b) The tool (chain handler) used for stowing chain must have a handle of adequate length so crew are working at a safe distance from the chain locker entrance. c) Crew members shall avoid inserting limbs inside the chain locker at all times . d) Physical contact will never be made with moving chains. e) If the chain handler's tool becomes entangled with moving chain LET GO of the tool, immediately inform the Windlass operator to STOP heaving and vacate the forecastle compartment.

my:Hazard.my:Description: Lack of communication between chain handlers, windlass operator and bridge
my:Hazard.my:ControlMeasures: a) Prior to operations and in accordance with the enclosed space procedures communications (UHF) must be established and confirmed all in good working order. b) Throughout operations communications must be maintained between the windlass operator, OOW on the Bridge and Chain Handlers.

my:Hazard.my:Description: Manual Handling inside the Focsle during high temperatures - exhaustion / dehydration
my:Hazard.my:ControlMeasures: a) Ensure that the work load is rotated. Not any one person will conduct all of the job. When a crew member is becoming exhausted / dehydrated they must stop for a break and / or hand over to other crew. b) The responsible person must monitor crew welfare through out and stop operations as required. c) Crew must be supplied fresh drinking water. d) The ventilation for the forecastle must remain operational throughout.
